div.div:
Joel - June 20, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.11
DOES NOT WORK
I paid for this app. It used to work. Now it does not and leaves zero byte files. Most unhappy. Will consider suing or participating in class action if not fixed. Clearly myself and hundreds of others are not alone.

Meghraj - June 20, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.11
not working after ice update on s2
THis was working 'unwell ' anyways b4 the update until the Ice update on my s2 after which its not at al working . Beware guys dont buy.

Kable - June 30, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.11
Only works on rooted Galaxy S2
Out going voice very weak if on speaker mode.

Ramji - June 23, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.9.11
Catch up
After upgrading to 4.0.3, the total recall doesn't work. What is rooting? Update with root facility. I am a registered version user.

Adi - July 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.11
Best for rooted s2
I'm using it on a samsung s2 swith ics that has been rooted. It s the best out there. Both voices are loud and clear. The interface needs an upgrade but other than that no problems. I bought it and i have no regrets! Cheers!

EDWARD - July 4, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.11
DITTO - DOES NOT WORK!
By Joel. I paid for this app. It used to work. Now it does not and leaves zero byte files. Most unhappy. Will consider suing or participating in class action if not fixed. Clearly myself and hundreds of others are not alone. I have a an SGS2 and now waiting for my new SGS3 to ship from Verizon. I am all in on the Class Action Lawsuit! Let me know at (ers2258@gmail.com)

Sanjay - June 30, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S3 with version 1.9.10b
Good if works
I am using this for few months problem is & was that it doesn't record all calls some call recordings are missed why God knows .Developers never replied .Now latest problem is that it doesn't record any call now as I have upgraded my phone software to latest one 4.0.3.Appears to be a waste of money .I shifed to Galaxy S 3 and installed this again but still not working .

Tamás - June 12, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.10b
Useless on S2 running stock official ICS
The mic recording feature is totally unusable, you can't hear the other person. Doesn't use contact's name in the record's name even if it presents and option checked. Sorry, but actually is a piece of crap. Please support the official Samsung 4.0.3 / I9100XXLPQ firmware or refund required if can't fix. FYI It worked well with Gingerbread 2.3.5.

Peter - June 12, 2012 - Version 1.9.10b
Like it
Totally ace on my S2. Don't understand all the negative comments

I have been using this app to record some voice calls for a few months with entire satisfaction so far. I was a bit concerned by the upgrade to ICS, but this is still working well actually. The app is a bit too expensive though.

Marko - May 5, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.8b2
Why to root?

laurh - May 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.8b2

And if I have no ideea about ROOT ? There is still hope ?

Istvan - May 1, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.8b2
From fair to bad to worse
While this app was fairly stable at the beginning (I've bought it when I still had Gingerbread), it started to degrade, to end up becoming a total crap on ICS. I have my SGS2 rooted, but this app is still unusable. Worse, it makes the phone unusable, because it freezes it for about 1 minute when trying to place a call. So, for people who're thinking to buy it: wait until it gets fixed, otherwise you'll get pissed off like me.

Suman - June 12, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.8b2
Call Recorder Galaxy S2 & S3.......SUCKS
I Purchased the software for Rs360, It was working micely on my samsung galaxy S2 android 2.3.4 but install it new ICS OS i really got fucked up.......Call Recorder Galaxy S2 & S3........IT SUCKS. PLEASE DONT BUY THIS TO MAKE A FOOL OF YOURSELF.

gs2 user

Chris - April 12, 2012 - Version 1.9.7b3

Amitay - April 11, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7b3
Does not work on...
S2 updated to ICS. Used to work perfect on older versions of Android but no more! DON'T Buy this until they fix it!

Charlie - April 3, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7b2
Stopped working on Ice Cream Sandwich
This worked fine on an uprooted Galaxy S2 but following the update to ICS v4.0.3 it no longer recorded. Wasted £5 and doesn't seem to be a way to get a Support Ticket from their website. Disappointing, would not recommended.

Pinaki - May 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.9.7b2
Recording issue
I was using TR on my Nokia E71 and it was perfect but in android seems to be not up to the mark. I have galaxy note with latest ICS update with 4.0.3 and it says its not compatible after upgrade, 5 star once it works with ICS and have a better recording quality or else look out for some better options . Hope this get fixed soon

Mike - April 1, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7b2
Awesome!
Just what i need.

Peter - June 30, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Tab with version 1.9.7b
Df
Using the old version backup on Titanium, working fine. Galaxy Tab.

MikeMcGuire - March 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7b
Great!
This is the best call recorder available for Android. Hands down!

Bigos - March 26, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7
Works on ICS
After update works like it used to before ICS but your phone needs to have been Rooted. Galaxy s2 I9100.

Reviewer - March 28, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7
Nice design but UNRELIABLE....TOTALLY.
Sadly, I've had to downgrade my rating of this potentially excellent app to only 2 stars. As with other people here, on numerous occasions I've discovered AFTER LONG CALLS that the recording has failed. THE APP JUST CANNOT BE RELIED UPON, & IS THEREFORE, EFFECTIVELY, USELESS. So far, I've never achieved a recording over 10 min's. The lost recordings aren't in the list, but do show up using a separate file explorer app. Unfortunately, they are incomplete recordings -having weirdly been terminated part way through the call. OTHER BUGS & SUGGESTIONS; 1) Could benefit from a nicer looking GUI and higher recording levels. 2) Whilst playing back a recording, if one changes the phone's orientation from portrait to landscape & then back to portrait, the player controls disappear. This prevents one from pausing or stopping the playback, even if one force-closes the app, or switches the phone to Standby! The only way to shut it up is to wait for it to finish playing, or power-down the phone.....quite annoying! THE DEV'S SAY THEY'RE AWARE OF ALL THESE ISSUES -PLEASE FIX ASAP!! (My phone is not rooted.)

Roy True - March 28, 2012 - Version 1.9.7
Excellent App with Some Glitches on Longer Calls
I am running the paid version on Samsung SGS2 rooted with gingerbread. The app works best when using the AMR file type. I use it to prompt me to rename the recording and email it after the call. The app works well 80% of the time. However, on long calls, like 30 minutes, it tends to stop recording. when this happens, you do not get a prompt to rename the call. The call recording is not listed in the app. You can find the recording with a file manager (like Astro) and rename it and email it. But this is a pain. Further, you may not have the entire call recorded. I think this has something to do with the file size. AMR is a smaller file size. But when the call recording file gets too big, the app crashes. Another problem is the app does not notify you when it has crashed. So you do not realize that you did not get a portion of the call recorded until it is too late. If the app notified you of crashes (with a vibration) during the call, then you could either, restart the app, get off the call, call the person back, etc. I hope the developer fixes these glitches because I really like this app and find it very useful. Last update fixed crashes. Was crashing after every use.

Johan - March 31, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7
Great!!!

Tzachi Noy - March 27, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.7
Constantly crashed since last update

Santo - March 22, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.9.5
Santoz
Unable to hear the caller at all. appearance looks promising but performance not good at all as promised by the developer

Vinay Reddy - March 22, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.5
Naming Option in Call Records- A Worry!!
I feel this is one of the best tools u need in todays market...people speak a thing and then they claim they have never spoken it a few minutes later...this is a very good tool to get things under control cause u have the proof with you....this is really good...the voice of both (the caller and the receiver) is really audible...very clear....I personally have a great confusion while tracing out the call records as it saves the file with the 'date + time + caller name/number'. I would have rated it 5++ if it

George - March 21, 2012 - Version 1.9.5
Ice Cream Sandwich
Great app, but current version doesn't work with ICS 4.0.3. Epic 4G Touch. Please fix

Manas - March 20, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.5
In paid ver. also manual recording during a call doesnt works.. Else its a ...
In paid ver. also manual recording during a call doesnt works.. Else its a good produxt Very nice... Try n improve the theme and layout..

Pinkesh
Nice n useful

Vitali - March 20, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.5
Ice Cream Sandwich
Does not work on Android 4.0.3

Harry - March 9, 2012 - Version 1.9.4
Whish it would record with Bluetooth SSGS2E4GT
Using on Sprint Samsung Galaxy S2 Epic 4G Touch. Best recorder I've found for recording both sides of the conversation. The only draw back I've noticed is that when connected to my car's bluetooth the incoming voice is muted so you cannot hear the caller. Of course when driving is when I would like it to work best for note taking. There is a seting to avoid recording while on Bluetooth. So if your driving and need to record the conversation you could pull over, turn the bluetooth off, and start the recorder manually. There also a handy way to manually record notes to yourself. You can include the date, time and caller in the recording title and you can modify the name. I had a MO PHO and could not find anything that worked on it for call recording.

Alon - May 31, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.4
The only impotant call not recorded
Still in ginger. The app records all the stupid short calls. Had one important call of over 1 hour, from a privet number - didn't record it!!! Dudes!

FilGov - April 30, 2012 - Version 1.9.4
Above average
All good except price, still best call recorder for Samsung Galaxy S2 on the market.

Narq - March 4, 2012 - Version 1.9.4
doesn't work on ICS.
very bad UI and lots of bugs that aren't fixed. Worked alright on gingerbread, but at this price with so many users it should be much better maintained.

Greg - March 5, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.4
Phone bricking app
On galaxy s 2 this app slowly shuts down base functionality. Only solution is to run a factory re set. This is with all blue tooth functions disabled which also defeats the purpose of this app. Waste of money. A real shame as I have this app on my old symbian phone that worked perfectly.

No problem
When I hv this on my ph 1st day, I tried out different settings & monitor it till I got it right, been working well since. Only issue is when 2nd call ring even if I don't answer it, existing call will stop its recording. Overall a very efficient app.

Nick Of Time - February 27, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.3
For me? 100% perfect. Zero issues.
I have not had a single issue with CR. It never misses a recording, unless I had *just* killed all apps via a Task Killer. However, it seems CR reloads itself after a minute or two, so this isn't even an issue. I had some recording corruption on my first two recordings, but only after I had copied the .wav's from internal memory to SD card to computer. If I copy the files from internal memory to computer via the USB cable, it works 100% of the time. The good: Works exactly how I need it to. Records incomin

G. - February 24, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.3
FINALLY!
A True call recorder. Been waiting over a year for this! So far, has worked well w/out BT & speakerphone. Hear other "party's" voice l&c. Sprint E4GT

K - February 26, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.9.3
Good app
I could have given this app 5* if only I was able to playback the recorded audio. This developer has done a great job but this app needed a lot of future bugs fixes. I will not remove this app but wait for the future update. Its a good interface if only the playback works.

:)

Also the free trail version is a better one than the paid one.

GS2.

excellent

Their answers reflect they don't even read what you send them, they just throw out solutions ALL of which I told them I had already tried. Demo version worked awesome. Paid version sucks! Don't waste your money or time!!!

Working well
Loving this. Records without any trouble. Only issue that it won't record calls where bluetooth headset is used - which is my preferred option. Once this work, will be perfect for me. I have it set to record everything, so makes like easier for going back to recordings where lots of facts / figures are discussed - am dealing with lots of calls with utility companies, lawyers, etc. so makes my life much easier.

Menashe - December 10, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.9.1
סוף סוף תוכנת הקלטת שיחות שעובדת!
השתמשתי בדמו ולאחר שווידאתי שהתוכנה עובדת רכשתי אותה. שומעים היטב את שני הצדדים המדברים - ללא ספיקר - שיחות יוצאות ושיחות נכנסות. ניתן לשחק עם ההגדרות ולהתאים את התוכנה לצרכים האישיים. כל ההגדרות עובדות ללא דופי, למעט השליחה האוטומטית של השיחות לג'ימייל שלא תמיד מעבירה את השיחה. שימו לב – התוכנה מתאימה ל: For Samsung Galaxy S2 (SGS2) users only! הציון שנתתי – 85. עם מימשק נוח יותר, ידידותי יותר ויפה יותר הייתי נותן 100.

div.p: I have purchased the full version and It nevers runs satisfactory. If you have good luck, then it will record once in a 10 times call. If you have additional money it is better to donate rather than purchasing this software,which never runs. Also when I send mail to customer service, they have no proper solution for my problem. Unfortunately It is not possible negative ranking otherwise I would have award it.
The app force closes after the call was recorded and refuses to send the call by e mail at the latest update. samsung galaxy s 2

div.div:

div.p: Will not install to stock firmware even when rooted with 4.0.3. But will work on 4.04 Res remix mod. I need this to work and am running a custom rom to make it happen.
